rename.from: F13-F24 keys missing from LwjglInput (LWJGL 2 backend)

body:
I might work on a pull request adding in all of these missing keys (including the related issues).
I've never used GWT or any of the iOS backends so those will require me to research.

Are there any other keys that are missing that I should add in?

Also, what should I do about keys that only exist on some backends?

@EtK2000 to know what's still missing, you'd have to research the related issues. Try to begin your work based on https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/5207 (and probably https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/2592) instead of doing a entirely new PR.

As to the keys that exist only on some backends - I guess the idea is to implement all of them in the root Input class, and simply leave them unmapped in the backends that miss them.
None of those pulls seem to actually map the keycodes on other backends, no wonder they weren't accepted.

Ok, I'm confused as to why you wouldn't implement them in the backends if you're already adding them.
Yes, his had LWJGL2 backend, but none others.

Frankly? It's probably mostly because covering all the backends is equal to creating a lot of code (that should also be most probably covered by tests due to input handling being crucial to libGdx's stability BTW), and e.g. back in the days I was doing libGdx game development while being paid by the hour. Nobody would pay me to write code that our project wouldn't use; even if I did it for fun (which I didn't), I would probably only cover those backends I would most probably use (Android & LWJGL3, maybe RoboVM or MOE too).

Hello, I would like to request prioritizing adding at least caps lock to the list of keys.
Caps lock is a commonly used keybind in games, and as far as I know libgdx has no way of detecting whether the capslock key is being pressed.
@wcko87 if you want this functionality to be added, write the PR and work for it to be merged :)
I'll get back to this at sometime, but I still can't implement anything on the iOS backends due to having no way to test.

Maybe this is also the Reason for #5857?
Fixing could also solve #2964

The Steam-Link tells that he is using a Mouse with 12 Buttons.

I actually have a different fix for the controller issue that seems to work for me on lwjgl2 backend.

I could submit that as a pull sooner than this.

Short info on how to add new keycodes:

* Add the keycodes to `Input.Keys`. If they exist for Android, use same codes as in Android's `KeyEvent` class. If not existant for Android, define a keycode non-clashing with Android's codes and document it as a comment.
* don't forget to define `Input.Keys.toString()` for the new codes
* Android: Due to Android's key code being same than libgdx, no change is needed in Android's backend
* GWT: Changes needed in `DefaultGwtInput.keyForCode()`. GWT's KeyCode.java is incomplete. Check with all browsers and OS at hand (might be slightly different) at https://keycode.info/
* RoboVM: `DefaultIOSInput.getGdxKeyCode()` needs change. Check `UIKeyboardHIDUsage` enum (yes, you can do that on any OS)
* Lwgl: Use `Keyboard` constants in `DefaultLwjglInput.getGdxKeyCode()` and `getLwjglKeyCode()`, Lwjgl3 is similar. Don't forget `LwjglAwtInput`
* CHANGES: Document newly added keycodes and if they are completely new (unmapped before) or changing a mapping existing before

If you follow these steps, merge is highly likely.

For any controller issues, take a look at the gdx-controllers repo.

@MrStahlfelge thank you for providing such useful information. I just created a wiki page with your comment.

https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Adding-new-Keycodes

issue.title: Add mappings for more numpad buttons, fixes #2524

labels.name: non-breaking w/ config
labels.description: Label for PRs that are non-breaking when configuration or game project is changed

issue.body:
This PR will map some of the unmapped numpad buttons so you can use them on desktop games.
If we have missed anything, please let us know and point us in the right direction.

Should fix #2524 

The following (unmerged) commits were used as references on how this should be done:

https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/2542/commits/d8c32b64790a664abe7e2e1411cb0005a10a6570
https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/2542/commits/f7fe73242cf70b4e1f73a561f9624fbc45780897

Done together with @GeorgeYildiz

issue.title: Add support for hardware keys F13 to F24
issue.body:
This adds keybindings for F13 to F24 as requested in #5389 

I couldn't test this because I have not such a keyboard. I derived the necessary keybindings from the given constants in the backends. For GWT and Android, there were no constants defined in code. [This page](https://source.android.com/devices/input/keyboard-devices) lists them for Android, [this one](https://keycode.info/) for JS. Lwjgl2 only supports F13 to F18, I did not forget the other ones. :)
